body_html:
It's not another copy, it's the same code. We're using git subtrees to sync both repos, and we're considering torch/* to be master, but we also accept PRs here, and push the changes upstream.

Not sure what do you mean when you say "Maybe pytorch can use some of the libraries provided by torch7?". We're using the same library code, but we can't use the same .so files, because of differences in TH_INDEX_BASE (that's why pytorch's libs have different soversion than the ones in Lua torch). We plan to make it a run time constant, but it's not yet implemented.

We're using the same library code, but we can't use the same .so files, because of differences in TH_INDEX_BASE (that's why pytorch's libs have different soversion than the ones in Lua torch). body:
It's not another copy, it's the same code. We're using git subtrees to sync both repos, and we're considering torch/* to be master, but we also accept PRs here, and push the changes upstream.

Not sure what do you mean when you say "Maybe pytorch can use some of the libraries provided by torch7?". We're using the same library code, but we can't use the same .so files, because of differences in `TH_INDEX_BASE` (that's why pytorch's libs have different soversion than the ones in Lua torch). We plan to make it a run time constant, but it's not yet implemented.
